title: Women’s Health III and IV Clinical Practice
description:
2 credit hours. In this elective course, students explore various, often conflicting, theories and principles underlying ethical decision making related to problems in health care practice, public health, and clinical research. Students apply a structured approach to critical analysis of a wide range of contemporary issues. The first group of sessions reviews prevalent theories and basic principles of health care ethics related to clinical practice, public health policy and practice, and research with human subjects. Practical frameworks for ethical analysis in each of those areas are presented. In subsequent sessions, controversial topics drawn from scholarly literature and current print and electronic media are discussed.

Interested students from any graduate program at Yale are welcome.
